description: A sacred ghat on the banks of the Ganges River in Rishikesh, known for its evening Ganga Aarti, attracting devotees and tourists alike.
timings: Open all day; Ganga Aarti: 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM

description: An ashram dedicated to Neem Karoli Baba, situated in the Kumaon region, known for its serene environment and spiritual significance.
A picturesque, crescent-shaped lake surrounded by hills, offering boating and scenic views, making it a popular tourist destination.
A famous ghat in Haridwar, known for its evening Ganga Aarti and believed to be the spot where Lord Vishnu left his footprint.
timings: Open all day; Ganga Aarti: 6:00 PM - 7:00 PM

description: Known as the 'Thousandfold Spring', this spot in Dehradun is famous for its sulfur-rich water springs and scenic beauty.
An ancient Shiva temple located in a cave, with water dripping from the ceiling, creating a unique worship experience.
A suspension bridge in Rishikesh, offering panoramic views of the Ganges and connecting various ashrams and temples.
An iron suspension bridge in Rishikesh, believed to be the spot where Lord Rama's brother Lakshman crossed the Ganges on a jute rope.
A sacred Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, located in the Garhwal Himalayas, attracting pilgrims from across the country.
best_time_to_visit: May to June, September to October

description: A national park and tiger reserve located in the foothills of the Himalayas, known for its rich biodiversity and scenic landscapes. It is home to several species of animals like tigers, elephants, and leopards.
